data.title: Diana Gurtskaya visited Dudinka
data.meta_description: In the small homeland of her deceased husband, memorial plaques were erected in his honor.
data.text:
#ARCTIC. #SIBERIA. THIS IS TAIMYR. In the capital of Taimyr, they honored the memory of Pyotr Kucherenko, a native of Dudinka, deputy minister of science and higher education of the Russian Federation. He passed away on May 20, 2023 at the age of 46. His relatives and friends came to participate in the events on the occasion, including his widow, people’s artist of Russia Diana Gurtskaya, his son Konstantin Kucherenko and his older sister Alexandra Komleva, the press service of the Taimyr administration reports.

In honor of Pyotr Kucherenko, the Taimyr head Evgeny Vershinin unveiled a memorial plaque on the house where the northerner lived. Also, a memorial tablet was installed on the building of Dudinka secondary school No. 4, from which Peter graduated. In April 2024, in order to perpetuate the memory of the famous graduate, the school was named after Pyotr Kucherenko.

In the assembly hall of the educational institution, students and teachers with words of respect and pride recalled the activist’s school years, where he showed his leadership qualities and excellent organizational skills.

“I will never tire of thanking you for the school being named after my husband. This is memory. He was always proud of his small homeland. It’s unusual for me to speak loudly, but at the moment I would like to say that Pyotr was a man to be proud of. He did a lot for the country and wanted to do much more, but did not have time. He always loved to learn new things, was very purposeful, and always helped people”, Diana Gurtskaya recalled.

Diana and her family were warmly received in the capital of Taimyr. At the children’s art school named after. B.N. Molchanov, students of the Bel Canto vocal ensemble delighted the guests with their skills, and Semyon Yaptune demonstrated the sound of the bargan with northern motifs. The singer noted the guys’ talent and promised to come next time with a master class.

The day ended with a memorable evening at the Taimyr Museum of Local Lore, where Evgeny Vershinin presented Konstantin Kucherenko with a souvenir in the form of a map of Taimyr in memory of his father’s homeland.

Let us remind you that Pyotr Kucherenko was born in Dudinka on May 3, 1977. He was brought up in the family of Alexander Kucherenko, an employee of the Dudinka seaport, and Ekaterina Kucherenko, a chemistry teacher at Dudinka school No. 4. He graduated from school in 1994 with a silver medal, entered the RUDN University, then taught there, received the title of professor of legal sciences, and rose to the post of deputy minister of science and higher education. Recognized with various awards, including the medal of the Order of Merit for the Fatherland, II degree. He is also the author of more than 50 scientific, methodological and scientific works in the field of law.
